item.title: Corey Lewandowski, a Familiar Trumpworld Figure, Is at the Center of the ICE Uproar
item.description: Now a top aide to Kristi Noem, the homeland security secretary, Mr. Lewandowski has a long history of controversy in President Trump’s orbit, but he has always found a way back from exile.
item.dc:creator: Nick Corasaniti and Hamed Aleaziz
item.media:description: Corey Lewandowski and Kristi Noem, the homeland security secretary, met with President Trump on Monday for nearly two hours as the administration faced intense pressure to ease up federal immigration agents’ aggressive tactics in Minnesota.

item.title: Tails of the City: San Francisco’s Latest Animal Sensation Is a Mountain Lion
item.description: The 2-year-old male was safely captured after he got stuck between two apartment buildings.
item.dc:creator: Heather Knight

item.title: Democrats Restore Minnesota House to Even Split Amid Immigration Turmoil
item.description: In special elections on Tuesday, Democrats won two left-leaning districts, preventing Republicans from holding a majority in the State House of Representatives.
item.dc:creator: Mitch Smith
item.media:credit: Liam James Doyle for The New York Times
item.media:description: The Minnesota House of Representatives at the Capitol in St. Paul.

item.title: Noem’s Handling of Shooting Put Her in Trump’s Penalty Box, but Just Briefly
item.description: Kristi Noem’s aggressiveness has sometimes given President Trump heartburn. She got a rebuke after a second killing by federal immigration agents but soon seemed to be back in his good graces.
item.dc:creator: Luke Broadwater, Hamed Aleaziz and Zolan Kanno-Youngs
item.media:description: The fatal shooting in Minnesota over the weekend was the latest episode in which high-profile efforts by Kristi Noem, the homeland security secretary, on behalf of President Trump’s policies have drawn intense criticism.

item.title: Man Rushes Ilhan Omar at Minneapolis Town Hall and Sprays Her
item.description: A man who had been sitting in the front row rushed at the Democratic representative and sprayed her with a strong-smelling liquid. He was removed by security and later booked into jail.
item.dc:creator: Reis Thebault, Lauren McCarthy and Ashley Ahn
item.media:credit: Victor J. Blue for The New York Times
item.media:description: A man rushed toward Representative Ilhan Omar, Democrat of Minnesota, and sprayed liquid on her on Tuesday night in Minneapolis. Security officials tackled him.

item.title: Trump Demonizes ICE Detainees in Minnesota as ‘Vicious’ Criminals
item.description: Hours after saying that he might “de-escalate” an aggressive ICE crackdown in Minnesota, Trump portrayed those arrested by federal agents there as “hardened, vicious, horrible criminals.”
item.dc:creator: Chris Cameron and Aishvarya Kavi
item.media:description: President Trump at the Horizon Events Center in Clive, Iowa, on Tuesday.

item.title: As Trump speaks in Iowa, a few thousand demonstrators protest Pretti’s killing.
item.dc:creator: Ann Hinga Klein
item.media:description: Demonstrators gathered across the street from the Horizon Event Center where President Trump delivered remarks on the economy in Clive, Iowa, on Tuesday.

item.title: D.H.S. Review Does Not Say Pretti Brandished Gun, As Noem Claimed
item.description: An initial report from an internal agency watchdog says the Minneapolis man was shot by law enforcement after resisting arrest, but makes no mention of the allegations leveled by a Trump administration official.
item.dc:creator: Madeleine Ngo, Alexandra Berzon and Hamed Aleaziz
item.media:credit: Jamie Kelter Davis for The New York Times
item.media:description: A makeshift memorial at the site where Alex Pretti was shot and killed by federal agents during an immigration enforcement operation.

item.title: Trump Threatens to Pull U.S. Help From Iraq if Former Leader Returns
item.description: Nuri Kamal al-Maliki, a former prime minister, has been nominated to the post by the main Shiite Muslim bloc in the Iraqi Parliament.
item.dc:creator: Anton Troianovski
item.media:description: Nuri Kamal al-Maliki, a former prime minister of Iraq, at a polling station in Baghdad in November.

item.title: Why Did the Trump Administration Silence Bovino on Social Media?
item.description: When the border chief got yanked from Minnesota, he lost access to his X account, too.
item.dc:creator: Shawn McCreesh
item.media:description: Gregory Bovino speaking in Minneapolis last week.

item.title: Minnesota Leaders Meet With White House Border Czar
item.description: Gov. Tim Walz and the mayor of Minneapolis, Jacob Frey, met separately with the Trump aide Tom Homan on Tuesday. All three described the discussions as a productive starting point.
item.dc:creator: Anushka Patil, Ernesto Londoño and Nick Corasaniti

item.title: Trump Suggests He Will ‘De-Escalate’ in Minneapolis, Without Offering Details
item.description: President Trump continued to put the blame on Alex Pretti for legally carrying a weapon with a permit, saying, “You can’t walk in with guns.”
item.dc:creator: Aishvarya Kavi and David E. Sanger
item.media:description: President Trump speaking at the White House before leaving for Iowa on Tuesday.

item.title: Republicans Shift Tone After Killings, Criticizing Trump’s Immigration Push
item.description: With the president signaling a pivot in his crackdown, G.O.P. lawmakers have felt freer to express concern. But it’s not clear what they are willing to do about it.
item.dc:creator: Carl Hulse
item.media:description: Republicans in Congress have starkly shifted their tone on the Trump administration’s aggressive immigration crackdown, conceding that something must change.

item.title: Trump Issues Order, but No Funds, to Push Faster Rebuilding After L.A. Fires
item.description: Over the weekend, the president demanded that local officials expedite rebuilding permits and ordered an audit of federal funds. But he was silent on the region’s stalled request for $34 billion in federal aid.
item.dc:creator: Shawn Hubler
item.media:credit: Mark Abramson for The New York Times
item.media:description: President Trump’s executive order on the rebuilding of Los Angeles communities after last year’s wildfires calls for an audit of federal fire assistance that California received immediately after the disaster.

item.title: City Prosecutors Join Forces to Bring Charges Against Federal Agents
item.description: Nine progressive prosecutors say they will work together to charge federal agents accused of wrongdoing, but they will face significant legal obstacles.
item.dc:creator: Shaila Dewan
item.media:credit: Jenn Ackerman & Michelle Gustafson for The New York Times

item.title: Virginia Judge Blocks Democrats’ Efforts to Redraw Congressional Maps
item.description: Democratic leaders vowed to appeal the lower court ruling, which found that the legislative process behind the redistricting push was improper.
item.dc:creator: Campbell Robertson
item.media:description: The Virginia General Assembly convened earlier this month for a new session that included a vote on redistricting and an address by the state’s new Democratic governor, Abigail Spanberger, who greeted legislators, below, as she entered the chamber.

item.title: Democrats Push to Impeach DHS Secretary Kristi Noem After Minneapolis Shooting
item.description: Following the fatal shooting in Minneapolis, a drive to impeach the homeland security secretary has drawn dozens more Democratic supporters, including the party’s top three leaders.
item.dc:creator: Michael Gold
item.media:credit: Tierney L. Cross/The New York Times
item.media:description: From left, Representatives Pete Aguilar, Democrat of California and the Democratic Caucus chair; Hakeem Jeffries, Democrat of New York and the minority leader; and Katherine Clark, Democrat of Massachusetts and the minority whip, at a news conference in Washington this month.

item.title: Judge Temporarily Blocks Deportation of 5-Year-Old Detained by ICE in Minnesota
item.description: An image of the boy, wearing a Spider-Man backpack as he was detained by federal agents, became a symbol of the immigration crackdown in Minnesota.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Bogel-Burroughs
item.media:credit: Sophie Park for The New York Times
item.media:description: A protester holding an artwork of Liam Conejo Ramos in Portland, Maine, last week.

item.title: Texas Moves to Curtail H-1B Visas
item.description: Gov. Greg Abbott said the state would investigate public agencies and universities that employ those with H-1B visas, a program the Trump administration has also targeted.
item.dc:creator: J. David Goodman and Vimal Patel
item.category: American Assn of Colleges and Universities
item.media:description: Gov. Greg Abbott has sought to expand on policies coming out of the Trump administration.

item.title: Senator Warnock Says ‘Soul of Our Nation Is at Stake’ During Visit to Minneapolis
item.description: The Georgia Democrat said he would push to block ICE funding when he returned to Washington.
item.dc:creator: Chris Hippensteel
item.media:credit: Victor J. Blue for The New York Times
item.media:description: Senator Raphael Warnock, Democrat of Georgia, on Tuesday at the site where federal agents shot and killed Alex Pretti in Minneapolis on Saturday.

item.title: TikTok Blames Technical Problems After Users Claimed It Blocked ICE Posts
item.description: Some users had accused the app of blocking them from posting videos about Immigration and Customs Enforcement. The app said it was a power outage issue.
item.dc:creator: David McCabe
item.media:credit: Patrick T. Fallon/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images
item.media:description: TikTok’s U.S. entity said in a statement on Monday that a power outage at an American data center had impeded users from uploading new videos.

item.title: One Person Is Wounded in Shooting Involving U.S. Border Patrol in Arizona
item.description: The man, Patrick Gary Schlegel, was in custody and expected to be charged after shooting at a federal helicopter, the authorities said. The shooting is under investigation.
item.dc:creator: Christine Hauser and Hannah Ziegler
item.media:description: A border area in Arivaca, Ariz. The area where the shooting occurred has been the focus of border enforcement for decades.

item.title: How Computer Warfare Is Becoming Part of the Pentagon’s Arsenal
item.description: The military tested a new approach in Venezuela and during strikes on Iranian nuclear facilities.
item.dc:creator: Julian E. Barnes and Adam Sella
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
item.media:description: The United States took power off-line in Caracas, Venezuela, to help military forces capture former President Nicolás Maduro this month.

item.title: On Immigration, the G.O.P. Finds Itself in a Shocking Place: On Defense
item.description: Since President Trump’s rise, the issue has been a strength for the party. But now, after the chaos in Minnesota, Democrats see an opening and some Republicans worry that Mr. Trump is going too far.
item.dc:creator: Reid J. Epstein and Lisa Lerer
item.media:credit: Victor J. Blue for The New York Times
item.media:description: Protesters rallying outside the Minneapolis office of Senator Amy Klobuchar, a Minnesota Democrat, demanding she vote against funding for Immigration and Customs Enforcement.

item.title: Washington D.C. Delegate Eleanor Holmes Norton Announces Retirement
item.description: The 88-year-old nonvoting delegate for Washington, D.C., who has retreated from her duties amid declining health, made it official that she would retire at the end of her term.
item.dc:creator: Megan Mineiro
item.media:description: Delegate Eleanor Holmes Norton announced her retirement.

item.title: Mark Carney Rejects Suggestions That He Walked Back His Davos Speech to Trump
item.description: Scott Bessent said that the Canadian prime minister had recanted his call on middle powers to no longer accommodate the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Ian Austen
item.media:credit: Patrick Doyle/The Canadian Press, via Associated Press
item.media:description: Prime Minister Mark Carney of Canada pushed to stop accommodating the United States during the World Economic forum in Davos, Switzerland.

item.title: Yale Offers Free Tuition to Families With Incomes Under $200,000
item.description: Other costs would also be waived for students whose families earn less than $100,000. Yale joins other elite schools offering more generous financial aid, including Penn, Harvard and M.I.T.
item.dc:creator: Stephanie Saul
item.media:credit: Christopher Capozziello for The New York Times
item.media:description: The Yale University campus in New Haven, Conn.

item.title: Andrea Lucas, EEOC Chair, Recasts Workplace Discrimination in Trump’s Image
item.description: Andrea Lucas, the chair of the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission, has said she wants to undo years of what she describes as activist excess around labor law.
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Davis O’Brien
item.media:credit: Alyssa Schukar for The New York Times
item.media:description: Andrea Lucas, the chair of the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission, said she was determined to undo the consequences of an “aggressive focus by D.E.I. activists.”

item.title: U.S. Population Growth Slows Sharply as Immigration Numbers Plunge
item.description: New census estimates show the effects of falling birthrates and President Trump’s anti-immigration policies. As his term continues, immigration is expected to drop even further.
item.dc:creator: Jeff Adelson and Sabrina Tavernise
item.media:credit: Scott McIntyre for The New York Times
item.media:description: Population growth in Florida slowed markedly last year, according to new census estimates.

item.title: Troop Casualties in Ukraine War Near 2 Million, Study Finds
item.description: The number of deaths, injuries and missing is approaching a grim milestone after nearly four years of fighting.
item.dc:creator: Helene Cooper
item.category: Center for Strategic and International Studies
item.media:credit: Brendan Hoffman for The New York Times
item.media:description: The funeral of a Ukrainian soldier in Uzhhorod, Ukraine, last year. The latest accounting of casualties came after talks among Russian, Ukrainian and American officials ended on Saturday on a rare positive note.

item.title: Florida State Senator Ileana Garcia Warns Immigration Will Cost G.O.P. the Midterms
item.description: State Senator Ileana Garcia, who is Cuban American, said the fatal shooting of Alex Pretti by Border Patrol agents in Minneapolis was “abhorrent.”
item.dc:creator: Patricia Mazzei
item.media:description: Florida State Sen. Ileana Garcia sees herself as a truth-teller within her party. The killing of Alex Pretti by Border Patrol agents in Minneapolis, she said, was “abhorrent.”

item.title: Trinidadian Families File Wrongful Death Lawsuit Over Boat Strike by U.S. Military
item.description: The case tests the Trump administration’s argument that its extrajudicial killings of people suspected of smuggling drugs at sea have been lawful.
item.dc:creator: Charlie Savage
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
US Strikes on Alleged Drug Traffickers (2025- )
item.media:description: A memorial held by family members of Chad Joseph, one of two Trinidadian men whom the U.S. military apparently killed in a boat strike in the fall, in Las Cuevas, Trinidad and Tobago, in October.

item.title: She’s the Face of Trump’s Aviation Safety Board, and She’s a Democrat
item.description: Jennifer Homendy, the outspoken chairwoman of the National Transportation Safety Board, is reclaiming the spotlight at a meeting on Tuesday about the Washington, D.C., crash that killed 67.
item.dc:creator: Karoun Demirjian
item.media:description: Jennifer Homendy, the chairwoman of the National Transportation Safety Board, reconvening a hearing in July on the midair collision above Washington.

item.title: Judge Orders ICE Chief to Appear in Court Over Potential Contempt
item.description: In a brief ruling, the Minnesota judge wrote that the unusual order was necessary because “the extent of ICE’s violation of court orders is likewise extraordinary.”
item.dc:creator: Alan Feuer
item.media:credit: Audra Melton for The New York Times
item.media:description: ICE’s acting director, Todd Lyons, was ordered to personally explain the agency’s actions to a federal judge.

item.title: A History of the Department of Homeland Security, the Agency Overseeing ICE
item.description: Established after the Sept. 11 attacks to protect the country against terrorism, the agency absorbed immigration functions that have become its focus under President Trump.
item.dc:creator: Christina Morales
item.media:description: President George W. Bush signing the legislation that officially created the Homeland Security Department in 2002.

item.title: Body Cam Video Related to the Shooting of Alex Pretti in Minneapolis Is Being Reviewed
item.description: The Department of Homeland Security said body camera footage, taken from multiple angles, was being examined, as local officials sought to ensure evidence was preserved.
item.dc:creator: Claire Moses
item.media:credit: Victor J. Blue for The New York Times
item.media:description: A photograph of Alex Pretti at the site where he was killed by federal agents in Minneapolis, Minnesota.

item.title: Alexander Vindman, of Trump Impeachment Fame, Runs for Senate in Florida
item.description: Mr. Vindman will run for the Democratic nomination to take on Senator Ashley Moody, a Republican. The race is an uphill fight for Democrats, but Mr. Vindman could be a strong fund-raiser.
item.dc:creator: Shane Goldmacher
item.category: Trump-Ukraine Whistle-Blower Complaint and Impeachment Inquiry
item.media:description: Alexander Vindman testifying before Congress in 2019.

item.title: Here’s the latest.
item.dc:creator: Reis Thebault, Nicholas Bogel-Burroughs, Hamed Aleaziz, Chris Cameron and David E. Sanger

item.title: After Alex Pretti’s Killing, A Divided America Wonders What’s Next
item.description: Scenes from the violent unrest in Minneapolis played on a loop in many American households over the weekend, prompting reflection about where the nation is heading.
item.dc:creator: Dan Barry
item.media:description: A memorial for Alex Pretti at the spot where he was shot and killed by federal agents in Minneapolis.

item.title: Safety Board Blames F.A.A. For Multiple Failures in D.C. Crash
item.description: The National Transportation Safety Board found the probable causes of the midair collision last year included poorly designed flight routes and ignored warnings about risks.
item.dc:creator: Karoun Demirjian and Kate Kelly
item.media:credit: Caroline Gutman for The New York Times
item.media:description: Jennifer Homendy, the National Transportation Safety Board chairwoman, speaking after the crash at Ronald Reagan Washington National Airport last year. The board plans to publish a full report on the crash.

item.title: As Trump Promotes Economy in Iowa, Many Residents Feel Pain
item.description: Farmers are critical to Iowa’s economy. They have been battered by President Trump’s tariffs and are not experiencing the “golden age” that the president promised.
item.dc:creator: Alan Rappeport
item.media:description: President Trump visited a restaurant on Tuesday in Davenport, Iowa. The state has been struggling under his economic policies.

item.title: Photo Shows ICE Agents Deploying at Minneapolis Protest After Alex Pretti Shooting
item.description: Violence in Minneapolis in the Wake of Alex Pretti’s Killing
item.dc:creator: David Guttenfelder and Thomas Gibbons-Neff

item.title: Maine’s Immigrant Students Stay Home as ICE Operation Ramps Up
item.description: When a class in Portland went out for recess on Thursday, their teacher recalled, some of the 6-year-old students anxiously asked, “What about the ICE people?”
item.dc:creator: Jenna Russell and Sophie Park
item.media:credit: Sophie Park for The New York Times
item.media:description: Educators from South Portland Middle School participate in a neighborhood watch at a bus stop in South Portland on Friday.

item.title: Trump Administration Social Media Posts Echo White Supremacist Messaging
item.description: A flurry of posts from the White House, Department of Labor and Department of Homeland Security have included images, slogans and even a song used by the white nationalist right.
item.dc:creator: Evan Gorelick
item.media:description: In the past month, government agencies have made dozens more social-media posts that include iconography associated with far-right extremist groups.

item.title: After Donations, Trump Administration Revoked Rule Requiring More Nursing Home Staff
item.description: Executives who donated to the president’s super PAC met privately with him and urged a repeal of the rule, which was intended to prevent neglect of patients.
item.dc:creator: Kenneth P. Vogel and Christina Jewett
item.media:credit: Shuran Huang for The New York Times
item.media:description: Starting in early August, nursing home executives began making donations that would eventually total nearly $4.8 million to MAGA Inc., a super PAC devoted to President Trump and run by his allies.
